subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etym}}
The oracle bone forms and bronze inscriptions show the {{liushu|p|nocap=1}} of a [[cricket]]. In its later form, became a {{Han compound|禾|𤒅|c1=s|c2=p|t1=rice|ls=psc|abb2=y}}. Often thought of as an {{Han compound|禾|t1=grain|火|t2=fire|ls=ic}}.

subSections.title: Readings
Compounds
Etymology
subSections.text:
{{wp|lang=ja}} {{wp|Autumn}}
{{ja-kanjitab|あき|yomi=k}} {{IPAfont|⟨aki1⟩}} → *{{IPAchar|/akʲi/}} → {{IPAchar|/aki/}} From {{inh|ja|ojp|sort=あき|-}}. Likely cognate with {{m|ja|明き|tr=aki||[[bright]]}}, {{m|ja|赤|tr=aka||[[red]]}}, {{m|ja|飽きる|tr=akiru||to become [[full]] up|pos=possibly in reference to the harvest}}, {{m|ja|空く|tr=aku||to become [[empty]]}}, {{m|ja|開く|tr=aku||to [[open]] up}}. However, the exact relationship of these terms remains unclear.
